alternative_title: Employers' tax and reporting for miners' coal
body:
$!As an employer, you don't have to report or pay tax and national insurance on any reasonable amount of free coal – or payments in place of free coal – you give to miners working for you.$!

This covers any employee who works at your colliery, except those working in clerical, administrative or technical roles.

##Technical guidance

The following guides contain more detailed information:

- [tax treatment of mineworkers: payments in lieu of free coal](http://www.hmrc.gov.uk/manuals/eimanual/eim66690.htm "Tax treatment of mineworkers: payments in lieu of free coal")
- [Class 1 National Insurance: payments to miners](http://www.hmrc.gov.uk/manuals/nimmanual/nim02095.htm "Class 1 National Insurance: payments to miners")
- [Class 1A National Insurance: extra-statutory concessions](http://www.hmrc.gov.uk/manuals/nimmanual/nim14310.htm "Class 1A National Insurance: extra-statutory concessions")
